traceability.evidence: 1. CLI FLAGS: src/cli-options-helpers.js implements parseProdMinAgeFlag, parseDevMinAgeFlag, parseProdSeverityFlag, parseDevSeverityFlag, with tests in test/cli-options-helpers.test.js covering parsing, error conditions, and missing values. 2. CONFIG FILE: src/config-loader.js validates and reads top-level `prod` and `dev` objects (minAge/minSeverity); test/cli.config-file.test.js verifies that `.dry-aged-deps.json` prod/dev settings are applied and overridden by flags. 3. DEPENDENCY TYPE: src/print-outdated.js uses loadPackageJson() to split prod vs dev and getDependencyType; test/printOutdated.prodDependency.test.js asserts the “Type” column shows “prod” for production entries; JSON/XML tests assert `type`/`` tags. 4. FALLBACK & DEFAULT: src/cli-options.js sets defaultProdMinAge = config.prod.minAge ?? minAge and defaultDevMinAge = config.dev.minAge ?? minAge (same for severity), so general `--min-age`/`--severity` apply to both when no prefixed flags; test/cli.flags.test.js and test/printOutdated.json.test.js confirm that behavior. 5. VALIDATION: parseIntegerFlag enforces integer ≥1 (tests reject 0/non-integers); parseStringFlag enforces valid severities; config-loader enforces 1–365 for config values with tests for invalid config. 6. OUTPUT INDICATION: Table output includes a “Type” column (header and rows in src/print-outdated.js and print-outdated-handlers.js); JSON output includes a `type` field; XML output includes `` (verified in xml-formatter tests).
